intro: Youngia lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces a single, showy yellow flower that develops into a crown-like seed head. Youngia lyrata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
